definition: meaning of a character
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: New words are created, and some old words develop new meanings.
sentences.chinese: 新字被創造出來，而一些舊字衍生新字義。

sentences.english: The two words are identical in meaning.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個字的字義完全一樣。

sentences.english: He writes "Mengzi Ziyi Shuzheng" in expectation of rebuilding study of Mencius.
sentences.chinese: 他作《孟子字義疏證》，以重建孟學原貌自期。

sentences.english: The dictionary gives us a wealth of phrases and sentences to illustrate meaning.
sentences.chinese: 這本詞典給了我們許多說明字義的詞組和句子。

sentences.english: Literally , it means pavilion beyond pavilion A famous restaurant in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 照字義，意思是樓外還有樓，是南京一家著名的賓館。

sentences.english: Illustration is often more useful than definition for giving the meanings of words.
sentences.chinese: 在給字義時，舉例常比下定義更有用。

sentences.english: Try to guess from the context.
sentences.chinese: 請試著從上下文猜測字義。

sentences.english: The semantic function of Chinese morphemes is embodied in the component units of word meaning.
sentences.chinese: 漢字義符的示意作用體現在字義組成單位中。
是英文字義“除去補色”的簡稱。

definition: meaning of a word
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
phonetic component of a Chinese character
the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
to transliterate/to transcribe/to transfer words onto a surface by direct contact (as with a decal)
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
to translate (to another language)/to convert
pun/play on words
transfer character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character with meanings influenced by other words/sometimes called mutually explanatory character
synonym
meaning of words/semantic
pronoun
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
